title: Investigate headless output not displaying
description:
When running `./ticker run <epic> --headless`, output is not being displayed to stdout.

Observed behavior:
- Ticker runs and completes tasks (verified via tk notes/list)
- But no output is shown in the terminal
- The system mentions output is being written to a file but the file isn't accessible

Files to investigate:
- internal/engine/headless_output.go - headless output formatting
- cmd/ticker/main.go - headless mode setup (look for --headless flag handling)

Potential issues:
1. Output buffering not being flushed
2. Output going to wrong stream (stderr vs stdout)
3. Output writer not properly connected
4. Goroutine output not reaching main thread
notes: 2026-01-15 08:10 - Fixed: The legacy Stream channel was only receiving output at the END of agent execution, not during streaming. Modified internal/agent/claude.go to send output deltas incrementally in the onUpdate callback. Now headless mode receives real-time streaming output.
